name: The Apocalypse
description:
"The Apocalypse" is a first person shooting game independently developed by me.

In this game you need to overcome things like hunger, thirst and cold. You can build shelters. Kill animals to get meat, explore relics and underground shelters to get materials, arm yourself against zombies and alien monsters, protect yourself from their monsters, and kill them to get booty. Build your own home.

Try your best to survive.

Currently, it is a stand-alone beta EA version, and the online version is expected to be launched in the second quarter of 2023

Game features

*Explore - various environments with huge scale, distinctive features and rich content. You can play freely in any way, including a variety of unique ecological environments and worlds.

*Making - Handmade and repaired weapons, clothing, armor, tools, vehicles, etc., with more than hundreds of recipes. Look for blueprints, and you can go deep into all kinds of powerful recipes.

*Build – Design your own fortress, including traps, electricity, automatic turrets, automatic doors, various gadgets and defensive positions, to survive from zombie attacks in a world that can be completely destroyed and shaped.

*Combat – fight against nearly dozens of zombie prototypes with different characteristics, including specially infected zombies with unique behaviors. The attack becomes more difficult and can bring infinite challenges.

*Survival – Experience the survival mechanism of the real hard core. The gain effect will have an impact on the game process, which can not only bring challenges, but also help survival.

*Destruction – buildings and topographical structures will collapse due to their own weight or poor architectural design after structural damage, which conforms to the real structural stability.

*Scavenge – Loot the best weapons, tools, and armor from the entire world.

*Driving – feel the extraordinary vehicle system, you can find cars in the open world.

*Farming or hunting – establish planting boxes to cultivate, obtain sustainable resources, or march into the wild to hunt several unique wild animals.
